Which sector, in your opinion, plays the most important role in driving the economic condition of a country? Please elaborate with reasons and examples.

Economy, as we know it, is a standalone term that is fuelled by multiple sources. Airline industry, railways and entertainment industry are some of the frontrunners that contribute maximum to the country's economy. However, when it comes to driving the economy forward in a more non-sale driven manner, nothing surprasses the food sector.

Lets compare the food sector to a business enteprise that has come up with a new product. Now, having completed the product lifecyle development, what is the focus of the company's strategies before they launch the product in the market? Target customers - that's where every professional with a sound business acumen will be laser-focussed at.

Coming back to the sectors; take, for instance, the railway sector. In any nation, a billion people travel by trains from one state to another, or between different locations in a single city. The profits earned are unprecedented. But, are there alternatives to trains? A whole lot of them. You have flights for long journeys and buses for shorter ones. Besides, going on the road-trips has always sounded tempting, so you don't have a dearth of individuals and families fuelling up their cars and setting off for a long road ahead. Same is the scenario with other sectors, as each one of them has an alternative that competes against it. Yes, there aren't many alternatives in entertainment industry, but there is a small percentage of population employed there.

The food sector does not depend on selling (in the true sense of the word). The 'target customers' of this industry are people from all strata, irrespective of which income group they belong to. Food sector launches products which everyone wants. You don't have to lure customers with outrageous offers and schemes. Food is not a luxury which only a selected people would buy. Rather, it is a necessity. And yes, it has no alternative.
